verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> or Song<WH7892> of David.<WH1732> Let God<WH430> arise,<WH6965> let his enemies<WH341> be scattered:<WH6327> let them also that hate<WH8130> him flee<WH5127> before<WH6440> him.

As smoke<WH6227> is driven<WH5086> away, so drive<WH5086> them away: as wax<WH1749> melts<WH4549> before<WH6440> the fire,<WH784> so let the wicked<WH7563> perish<WH6> at the presence<WH6440> of God.<WH430>
But let the righteous<WH6662> be glad;<WH8056> let them rejoice<WH5970> before<WH6440> God:<WH430> yes, let them exceedingly<WH8057> rejoice.<WH7797>

Sing<WH7891> to God,<WH430> sing<WH2167> praises to his name:<WH8034> extol<WH5549> him that rides<WH7392> on the heavens<WH6160> by his name<WH8034> JAH,<WH3050> and rejoice<WH5937> before<WH6440> him.
A father<WH1> of the fatherless,<WH3490> and a judge<WH1781> of the widows,<WH490> is God<WH430> in his holy<WH6944> habitation.<WH4583>

God<WH430> sets<WH3427> the solitary<WH3173> in families:<WH1004> he brings<WH3318> out those which are bound<WH615> with chains:<WH3574> but the rebellious<WH5637> dwell<WH7931> in a dry<WH6707> land.
O God,<WH430> when you went<WH3318> forth<WH3318> before<WH6440> your people,<WH5971> when you did march<WH6805> through the wilderness;<WH3452> Selah:<WH5542>

The earth<WH776> shook,<WH7493> the heavens<WH8064> also<WH637> dropped<WH5197> at the presence<WH6440> of God:<WH430> even Sinai<WH5514> itself<WH2088> was moved at the presence<WH6440> of God,<WH430> the God<WH430> of Israel.<WH3478>
You, O God,<WH430> did send<WH5130> a plentiful<WH5071> rain,<WH1653> whereby you did confirm<WH3559> your inheritance,<WH5159> when it was weary.<WH3811>
Your congregation<WH2416> has dwelled<WH3427> therein: you, O God,<WH430> have prepared<WH3559> of your goodness<WH2896> for the poor.<WH6041>
The Lord<WH136> gave<WH5414> the word:<WH562> great<WH7227> was the company<WH6635> of those that published<WH1319> it.
Kings<WH4428> of armies<WH6635> did flee<WH5074> apace: and she that tarried<WH5116> at home<WH1004> divided<WH2505> the spoil.<WH7998>

Though<WH518> you have lien<WH7901> among<WH996> the pots,<WH8240> yet shall you be as the wings<WH3671> of a dove<WH3123> covered<WH2645> with silver,<WH3701> and her feathers<WH84> with yellow<WH3422> gold.<WH2742>
When the Almighty<WH7706> scattered<WH6566> kings<WH4428> in it, it was white as snow<WH7949> in Salmon.<WH6756>
The hill<WH2022> of God<WH430> is as the hill<WH2022> of Bashan;<WH1316> an high<WH1386> hill<WH2022> as the hill<WH2022> of Bashan.<WH1316>

Why<WH4100> leap<WH7520> you, you high<WH1386> hills?<WH2022> this is the hill<WH2022> which God<WH430> desires<WH2530> to dwell<WH3427> in; yes,<WH637> the LORD<WH3068> will dwell<WH7931> in it for ever.<WH5331>
The chariots<WH7393> of God<WH430> are twenty<WH7239> thousand,<WH7239> even thousands<WH505> of angels:<WH8136> the Lord<WH136> is among them, as in Sinai,<WH5514> in the holy<WH6944> place.

You have ascended<WH5927> on high,<WH4791> you have led captivity<WH7628> captive:<WH7617> you have received<WH3947> gifts<WH4979> for men;<WH120> yes,<WH637> for the rebellious<WH5637> also,<WH637> that the LORD<WH3050> God<WH430> might dwell<WH7931> among them.
Blessed<WH1288> be the Lord,<WH136> who daily<WH3117> loads<WH6006> us with benefits, even the God<WH410> of our salvation.<WH3444> Selah.<WH5542>
He that is our God<WH410> is the God<WH410> of salvation;<WH4190> and to GOD<WH3069> the Lord<WH136> belong the issues<WH8444> from death.<WH4194>
But God<WH430> shall wound<WH4272> the head<WH7218> of his enemies,<WH341> and the hairy<WH1167> <WH8181> scalp<WH6936> of such an one as goes<WH1980> on still in his trespasses.<WH817>
The Lord<WH136> said,<WH559> I will bring<WH7725> again<WH7725> from Bashan,<WH1316> I will bring<WH7725> my people again<WH7725> from the depths<WH4688> of the sea:<WH3220>
That your foot<WH7272> may be dipped<WH4272> in the blood<WH1818> of your enemies,<WH341> and the tongue<WH3956> of your dogs<WH3611> in the same.
They have seen<WH7200> your goings,<WH1979> O God;<WH430> even the goings<WH1979> of my God,<WH410> my King,<WH4428> in the sanctuary.<WH6944>
The singers<WH7891> went<WH6923> before,<WH6924> the players<WH5059> on instruments followed after;<WH310> among<WH8432> them were the damsels<WH5959> playing with tambourines.<WH8608>
Bless<WH1288> you God<WH430> in the congregations,<WH4721> even the Lord,<WH136> from the fountain<WH4726> of Israel.<WH3478>

There<WH8033> is little<WH6810> Benjamin<WH1144> with their ruler,<WH7287> the princes<WH8269> of Judah<WH3063> and their council,<WH7277> the princes<WH8269> of Zebulun,<WH2074> and the princes<WH8269> of Naphtali.<WH5321>
Your God<WH430> has commanded<WH6680> your strength:<WH5797> strengthen,<WH5810> O God,<WH430> that which<WH2098> you have worked<WH6466> for us.
Because of your temple<WH1964> at<WH5921> Jerusalem<WH3389> shall kings<WH4428> bring<WH2986> presents<WH7862> to you.

Rebuke<WH1605> the company<WH2416> of spearmen,<WH7070> the multitude<WH5712> of the bulls,<WH47> with the calves<WH5695> of the people,<WH5971> till every one submit<WH7511> himself with pieces<WH7518> of silver:<WH3701> scatter<WH967> you the people<WH5971> that delight<WH2654> in war.<WH7128>
Princes<WH2831> shall come<WH857> out of Egypt;<WH4714> Ethiopia<WH3568> shall soon<WH7323> stretch<WH7323> out her hands<WH3027> to God.<WH430>
Sing<WH7891> to God,<WH430> you kingdoms<WH4467> of the earth;<WH776> O sing<WH2167> praises to the Lord;<WH136> Selah:<WH5542>
To him that rides<WH7392> on the heavens<WH8064> of heavens,<WH8064> which were of old;<WH6924> see,<WH2005> he does send<WH5414> out his voice,<WH6963> and that a mighty<WH5797> voice.<WH6963>
Ascribe<WH5414> you strength<WH5797> to God:<WH430> his excellency<WH1346> is over<WH5921> Israel,<WH3478> and his strength<WH5797> is in the clouds.<WH7834>

O God,<WH430> you are terrible<WH3372> out of your holy<WH4720> places: the God<WH410> of Israel<WH3478> is he that gives<WH5414> strength<WH5797> and power<WH8592> to his people.<WH5971> Blessed<WH1288> be God.<WH430>
